changes.reasoning: Initialize Next.js project with TypeScript configuration and build tooling. Sets up tsconfig.json for strict type checking with path aliases (@/*), configures Next.js with next.config.ts, and adds ESLint for code quality. This establishes the foundation for a modern, type-safe Next.js application.

Configure Tailwind CSS v4 with PostCSS for styling. Uses the new @tailwindcss/postcss plugin (required for Tailwind v4) instead of the legacy plugin. Sets up content paths to scan all pages, components, and app directory files for Tailwind class usage.

Define TypeScript types for the CodeWalker schema and commit visualization. The Changeset, Change, and FileChange types match the codewalker.md specification exactly. Additional types (ParsedHunk, FileDiff, CommitInfo) support parsing and displaying git diffs with line numbers and syntax highlighting.

Implement GitHub API integration utilities using Octokit. Provides functions to authenticate with GitHub, parse git diffs into structured hunks with line numbers, fetch commit information, and retrieve .codewalker/*.json tracking files from repositories. The parseHunks function handles the complex task of parsing unified diff format into individual lines with type (add/remove/context) and line numbers.

Create API routes for fetching GitHub data. Three endpoints provide: (1) listing pull requests for a repository, (2) getting commits for a PR or specific commit details with diffs, and (3) retrieving tracking files. All routes accept optional GitHub tokens for private repo access and higher rate limits.

Build PR and commit selection components. PRSelector displays a list of pull requests with their status and metadata, allowing users to click to view details. CommitList shows all commits within a selected PR with short SHAs, messages, and timestamps. Both components handle loading states and errors gracefully.

Create the core visualization component that displays code changes grouped by purpose. TrackingVisualizer fetches both the tracking file and commit diff, then renders changes grouped by their logical purpose with reasoning explanations. Each hunk is syntax-highlighted with green for additions, red for deletions, and includes accurate line numbers. Falls back to showing all diffs if no tracking file exists.

Build the main application UI with multi-step navigation flow. The page guides users through: (1) entering repository details and optional GitHub token, (2) selecting a pull request, (3) choosing a commit, and (4) viewing the visualization. Uses React state to manage the current step and selected items, with back buttons for easy navigation.

Add documentation and configuration examples. README.md provides comprehensive setup instructions, usage guide, and explanation of the CodeWalker tracking file format. .env.local.example shows the optional GitHub token configuration. CLAUDE.md ensures the CodeWalker skill is activated for this project.
